---------------------------------------------- selectcase $webrequesttype case "DYNAMIC" webload ; Get Data if ($procerror < 0) $webinfo("OUTPUT") = lfHtmlMessage("WEBLOAD Failed", $procerrorcontext) return -1 endif i = 1 getitem sOuter, $componentinfo($instancename, "OUTERENTITIES"), i while ($status > 0) reconnect "%%sOuter%%%" ; ", -1)) ; vMessage = $concat(vMessage, "
Additional:

__MESSAGE__
~ end

; ======================================================================================= ; Execution ok ; ---------------------------------------------- return (0) ; =======================================================================================

selectcase pStatus case 301 status_info.DUMMY = "Status 301 - Moved Permanently" ;TODO code to get redirect URL / out of scope of sample case 503 status_info.DUMMY = "Status 503 - Service Unavailable %%pContent%%%" elsecase status_info.DUMMY = "Request Unsucessful - Status %%pContent%%%" endselectcase

A Windows form implementation of calling the Random.org API. This is functionally the equivalent of the Web version. It also utilizes a Uniface service to show client to web, and client to server to web.
#include U:zProcError ; Report an unexpected failure in a proc statement.

#Comment ---------------------------------------------- #Comment start_of_references #ifdefined TEMPLATENAME #info symbol TEMPLATENAME is already or also defined as a global or local constant #endif #define TEMPLATENAME= #Comment

Calls the Random.org Random service. As it is a service this can be partioned from the client to a server.

operation GET_INTEGER params string pBase : IN string pNoRequired : IN numeric pStatus : OUT string pHeaders : OUT string pContent : OUT string pResponse : OUT endparams variables handle vUHTTP numeric vStatus string vURI string vBase numeric vMax, vMin, vNo_Required endvariables
newinstance "UHTTP", vUHTTP
; Ignore certificate errors as using https vStatus = vUHTTP->SET_FLAGS(3)
;Set the base that will be used to print the numbers, i.e., binary, octal, decimal or hexadecimal vBase = pBase
; Set the number of integers requested vNo_Required = pNoRequired
;Set the smallest/largest values allowed for each integer if (pBase = "2") vMin = 0 else vMin = 1 endif
vMax = pBase - 1
; Create URI vURI = "https://www.random.org/integers/?num=%%vNo_Required%%%&min=%%vMin%%%&max=%%vMax%%%&col=1&base=%%vBase%%%&format=plain&rnd=new"
; Do the HTTP GET via UHTTP pStatus = vUHTTP->SEND(vURI, "GET", "", "", pHeaders, pContent, pResponse)
end; operation GET_INTEGER
operation GET_STRINGS params numeric pNoOfStrings : IN numeric pStringLength : IN string pAlphas : IN string pDigits : IN numeric pStatus : OUT string pHeaders : OUT string pContent : OUT string pResponse : OUT endparams variables handle vUHTTP numeric vStatus string vURI numeric vNum, vLength endvariables
newinstance "UHTTP", vUHTTP
; Ignore certificate errors as using https vStatus = vUHTTP->SET_FLAGS(3)
; Create URI vURI = "https://www.random.org/strings/?num=%%pNoOfStrings%%%&len=%%pStringLength%%%&digits=%%pDigits%%%&upperalpha=%%pAlphas%%%&loweralpha=on&unique=on&format=plain&rnd=new"
; Do the HTTP GET via UHTTP pStatus = vUHTTP->SEND(vURI, "GET", "", "", pHeaders, pContent, pResponse)
end ; operation GET_STRINGS
operation GET_SEQUENCE params numeric pSeqEnd : IN numeric pStatus : OUT string pHeaders : OUT string pContent : OUT string pResponse : OUT endparams variables handle vUHTTP numeric vStatus string vURI endvariables
newinstance "UHTTP", vUHTTP
; Ignore certificate errors as using https vStatus = vUHTTP->SET_FLAGS(3)
; Create URI vURI = "https://www.random.org/sequences/?min=1&max=%%pSeqEnd%%%&col=10&format=plain&rnd=new"
; Do HTTP GET via UHTTP pStatus = vUHTTP->SEND(vURI, "GET", "", "", pHeaders, pContent, pResponse)
end ; operation GET_SEQUENCE

; ; Do not change the interface of public operations since the UNIFACE component engine ; relies on these when executing entity service behavior. The implementation can be modified. ; ; Exception: the interface and implementation of public operations named uz* can be modified. ; These operations are not used by the UNIFACE component engine. ;
; ; Entity Service operations ; public (inter-component) operations are named u*. ; partner (intra-component) operations are named z*. ; More details are listed at the bottom of this trigger. ;
#define keyError = -1 #define keyNew = 0
#define keyInHitList = 1 #define keyInDatabase = 2 #define primaryKey = 1
public operation uRetr<esvEntity> ; purpose: retrieve a list of occurrences given a particular profile ; pre: first READ trigger at client component params entity <esvEntity> : OUT ; list of retrieved occurrences occurrence <esvEntity> : IN ; profile occurrence string fieldList : IN ; fields to be retrieved into <esvEntity> string where : IN ; where clause for read (only used when called explicitly) string uWhere : IN ; uWhere clause for read (only used when called explicitly) endparams variables numeric n endvariables
if (where != "" & uWhere != "") $instancehandle()->zException("uRetr<esvEntity>", "One of the parameters 'where' and 'uwhere' must be empty.") return (-1) endif
$instancehandle()->zRetrA<esvEntity>(fieldList, n, where, uWhere) ; profile occ. is unpacked and made current. Retrieve the data.
if (n >= 0) set $subsetreturn("<esvEntity>") ; data to be returned is subsetted to the just retrieved set
if ($status < 0) $instancehandle()->zProcError($procerrorcontext) return (-1) endif endif
return (n) ; data is packed and returned by UNIFACE end ; uRetr<esvEntity>
public operation uStore<esvEntity> ; purpose: indicate a store transaction (i.e. a serie of Proc statements 'write' and 'delete' at the client) ; pre: Proc statement 'store' at client component
$inStore$ = 1 end ; uStore<esvEntity>
public operation uUpd<esvEntity> ; purpose: create or update an occurrence. Similar to uRem<esvEntity> ; pre: Proc statement 'write' at client component ; uStore params string fieldList : IN ; fields to be updated occurrence <esvEntity> : IN ; source occurrence: contains key + data for update endparams variables string keyFields numeric n endvariables
if (!$inStore$) $instancehandle()->zException("uUpd<esvEntity>", "uStore must be called before uUpd.") remocc "<esvEntity>" return (-1) endif
findkey "<esvEntity>", 1 ; look-up if we already have the source occurrence in our hitlist
selectcase $status
case <keyError> $instancehandle()->zProcError($procerrorcontext) remocc "<esvEntity>" ; remove source occurrence return (-1)
case <keyNew> ; not in our hitlist, nor in database creocc "<esvEntity>"
if (n = -1) return (-1) endif
setocc "<esvEntity>", $curocc+1 ; position on source occurrence moveocc "<esvEntity>", $curocc-1, fieldList ; move data, delete source occurrence and position on target occurrence
if ($status < 0) ; move data was unsucessful $instancehandle()->zProcError($procerrorcontext) remocc "<esvEntity>" ; remove source occurrence ... setocc "<esvEntity>", $curocc-1 remocc "<esvEntity>" ; ... and remove target occurrence return (-1) endif
$occhandle()->afterCreate(n) case <keyInHitlist> ; already as target occurrence in our hitlist (position now in $result) moveocc "<esvEntity>", $result, fieldList ; move data into target occurrence
if ($status < 0) ; move unsuccessful $instancehandle()->zProcError($procerrorcontext) remocc "<esvEntity>" ; remove source occurrence return (-1) endif
$occhandle()->afterUpdate(n)
case <keyInDatabase> ; already in database, but not in our hitlist. Retrieve into hitlist and update it. keyFields = $keyfields("<esvEntity>", <primaryKey>) putlistitems/id keyFields ; copy source occurrence's primary key data into keyFields creocc "<esvEntity>" ; create profile occurrence. getlistitems/id keyFields ; paste primary key data into profile occurrence
$instancehandle()->zRetrA<esvEntity>(fieldList, n, "", "") ; retrieve target
if (n < 0) ; retrieve unsucessful, target occurrence removed remocc "<esvEntity>" ; remove source occurrence return (-1)
else setocc "<esvEntity>", $curocc+1 ; position on source occurrence moveocc "<esvEntity>", $curocc-1, fieldList ; move data from source into target, delete source and position on target
if ($status < 0) ; move unsucessful $instancehandle()->zProcError($procerrorcontext) remocc "<esvEntity>" ; remove source occurrence return (-1) endif endif
$occhandle()->afterUpdate(n)
endselectcase
return (n) end ; uUpd<esvEntity>
public operation uRem<esvEntity> ; purpose: mark an occurrence for deletion. Similar to uUpd<esvEntity> ; pre: Proc statement 'delete' at client component ; uStore ; pre: uStore params occurrence <esvEntity> : IN ; source occurrence endparams variables numeric n endvariables
if (!$inStore$)
$instancehandle()->zException("uRem<esvEntity>", "uStore<esvEntity> must be called before uRem<esvEntity>.") remocc "<esvEntity>" ; remove source occurrence return (-1) endif
findkey "<esvEntity>", 1 ; look-up target occurrence
selectcase $status
case <KeyError> $instancehandle()->zProcError($procerrorcontext) remocc "<esvEntity>" ; remove source occurrence return (-1)
case <keyNew> ; already removed - done
case <keyInHitlist> moveocc "<esvEntity>", $result, "" ; remove source and position on target
if ($status < 0) ; move unsuccessful $instancehandle()->zProcError($procerrorcontext) return (-1) endif
case <keyInDatabase> $instancehandle()->zRetrA<esvEntity>("", n, "", "") ; retrieve it for removal
if (n < 0) return (n) endif endselectcase
$occhandle()->beforeRemove(n)
if (n = 0) remocc "<esvEntity>" endif
return (n) end ; UREM<esvEntity>
public operation uEndStore ; purpose: indicate store transaction is completed, start physical store process ; pre: last Proc statement 'write' or 'delete' at client component ; uStore variables numeric n endvariables
$inStore$ = 0 $instancehandle()->zSave<esvEntity>(n) ; communicate physical write and delete to DBMS return (n) end ; uEndStore
public operation uLock<esvEntity> ; purpose: lock occurrence ; pre: Proc statement 'lock' at client component params occurrence <esvEntity> : IN ; profile occurrence to be locked endparams variables numeric n endvariables
findkey "<esvEntity>", 1 ; look-up target occurrence
selectcase $status
case <keyError> $instancehandle()->zProcError($procerrorcontext) remocc "<esvEntity>" ; remove profile occurrence return (-1)
case <keyNew> $instancehandle()->zException("uLock<esvEntity>", "Occurrence does not exist.") remocc "<esvEntity>" ; remove profile occurrence return (-1)
case <keyInHitlist> moveocc "<esvEntity>", $result, "" ; remove profile occurrence and position on occurrence to be locked if ($status < 0) $instancehandle()->zProcError($procerrorcontext) remocc "<esvEntity>" ; remove profile occurrence return (-1) endif
case <keyInDatabase> $instancehandle()->zRetrA<esvEntity>("", n, "", "") ; retrieve it into hitlist
if (n < 0) return (n) endif endselectcase
lock n = $status
if (n < 0) $instancehandle()->zProcError($procerrorcontext) endif
return (n) end ; uLock<esvEntity>
public operation uCommit ; purpose: commit transaction on ESV subtype's DBMS path ; pre: Proc statement 'commit' at client component variables numeric n endvariables
commit n = $status
if (n < 0) $instancehandle()->zProcError($procerrorcontext) endif
return (n) end ; uCommit
public operation uRollBack ; purpose: rollback transaction on ESV subtype's DBMS path ; pre: Proc statement 'rollback' at client component variables numeric n endvariables
clear rollback n = $status
if (n < 0) $instancehandle()->zProcError($procerrorcontext)
endif
return (n) end ; uRollback
public operation uzGetCollHandle ; purpose: issue a handle to the ESV entity collection, in order to ; let the client directly invoke operations on it ; pre: - ; post: if handle exists, then h contains handle, else h = "" params handle h : OUT endparams
h = $collHandle("<esvEntity>") end ; uzGetCollHandle
public operation uzGetOccHandle ; purpose: issue a handle to the ESV entity's current occurrence ; let the client directly invoke operations on it ; pre: - ; post: if occurrence exists, then h contains handle, else h = "" params handle h : OUT endparams
h = $occHandle("<esvEntity>") end ; uzGetOccHandle
; ; Partner (intra-component) operations. ;
partner operation zRetrA<esvEntity> params string fieldList : IN numeric n : OUT string where : IN string uWhere : IN endparams
if (where != "") $where$ = where elseif (uWhere != "") $uWhere$ = uWhere endif
$selectlist ("<esvEntity>") = fieldList retrieve/a "<esvEntity>" n = $status
if (n < 0) $instancehandle()->zProcError($procErrorContext) remocc "<esvEntity>" ; remove profile endif end ; zRetrA<esvEntity>
partner operation zSave<esvEntity> params numeric n : OUT endparams
store/e "<esvEntity>" n = $status
if (n < 0) $instancehandle()->zProcError($procErrorContext) endif end ; zSave<esvEntity>
partner operation zProcError ; purpose: report an unexpected failure in a Proc statement ; client: - ; pre: context contains information about $procErrorContext params string pContext : IN endparams variables string vError string vErrorDescr string vOperationName endvariables

public web
variables handle vUHTTP numeric vStatus string vURI, vHeaders, vContent, vResponse string vBase numeric vMax, vMin, vNo_Required endvariables newinstance "UHTTP", vUHTTP
random.DUMMY = ""
; Ignore certificate errors as using https vStatus = vUHTTP->SET_FLAGS(3)
;Set the base that will be used to print the numbers, i.e., binary, octal, decimal or hexadecimal vBase = base.DUMMY
;Default the Number required if not set if (no_required.DUMMY = 0) no_required.DUMMY = 5 endif
; Set the number of integers requested vNo_Required = no_required.DUMMY
;Set the smallest/largest values allowed for each integer if (base.DUMMY = "2") vMin = 0 else vMin = 1 endif
vMax = base.DUMMY - 1
; Create URI vURI = "https://www.random.org/integers/?num=%%vNo_Required%%%&min=%%vMin%%%&max=%%vMax%%%&col=1&base=%%vBase%%%&format=plain&rnd=new"
; Do the HTTP GET via UHTTP vStatus = vUHTTP->SEND(vURI, "GET", "", "", vHeaders, vContent, vResponse) if (vStatus < 0) status_info.DUMMY = "Unable to generate random number at this time, error status %%vStatus%%" endif
if (vStatus = 200) random.DUMMY = vContent status_info.DUMMY = "Status 200 - OK" else call LP_HANDLE_ERROR(vStatus,vContent) endif
;Parameters ;Name Possible Values Description ;num [1,1e4] The number of integers requested. ;min [-1e9,1e9] The smallest value allowed for each integer. ;max [-1e9,1e9] The largest value allowed for each integer. ;col [1,1e9] The number of columns in which the integers will be arranged. The integers should be read (or processed) left to right across columns. ;base 2 | 8 | 10 | 16 The base that will be used to print the numbers, i.e., binary, octal, decimal or hexadecimal. ;format html | plain Determines the return type of the document that the server produces as its response. If html is specified, the server produces a nicely formatted XHTML document (MIME type text/html), which will display well in a browser but which is somewhat cumbersome to parse. If plain is specified, the server produces as minimalistic document of type plain text (MIME type text/plain) document, which is easy to parse. If you are writing an automated client, you probably want to specify plain here. ;rnd new | id.identifier | date.iso-date Determines the randomization to use to generate the numbers. If new is specified, then a new randomization will created from the truly random bitstream at RANDOM.ORG. This is probably what you want in most cases. If id.identifier is specified, the identifier is used to determine the randomization in a deterministic fashion from a large pool of pregenerated random bits. Because the numbers are produced in a deterministic fashion, specifying an id basically uses RANDOM &uBS;.ORG as a pseudo-random number generator. The third (date.iso-date) form is similar to the second; it allows the randomization to be based on one of the daily pregenerated files. This form must refer to one of the dates for which files exist, so it must be the current day (according to UTC) or a day in the past. The date must be in ISO 8601 format (i.e., YYYY-MM-DD) or one of the two shorthand strings today or yesterday.

variables numeric vStatus string vHeaders, vContent, vResponse endvariables
random.DUMMY = ""
;Default the Number required if not set if (no_required.DUMMY= 0) no_required.DUMMY = 5 endif
; Call service to do HTTP GET via UHTTP component activate "RANDOM_SERVICE".get_integer(base.DUMMY, no_required.DUMMY, vStatus, vHeaders, vContent, vResponse)
if (vStatus < 0) status_info.DUMMY = "Unable to generate random number at this time, error status %%vStatus%%" endif
if (vStatus = 200) random.DUMMY = vContent status_info.DUMMY = "Status 200 - OK" else call LP_HANDLE_ERROR(vStatus,vContent) endif
;Parameters ;Name Possible Values Description ;num [1,1e4] The number of integers requested. ;min [-1e9,1e9] The smallest value allowed for each integer. ;max [-1e9,1e9] The largest value allowed for each integer. ;col [1,1e9] The number of columns in which the integers will be arranged. If html is specified, the server produces a nicely formatted XHTML document (MIME type text/html), which will display well in a browser but which is somewhat cumbersome to parse. If plain is specified, the server produces as minimalistic document of type plain text (MIME type text/plain) document, which is easy to parse. If you are writing an automated client, you probably want to specify plain here. ;rnd new | id.identifier | date.iso-date Determines the randomization to use to generate the numbers. If new is specified, then a new randomization will created from the truly random bitstream at RANDOM.ORG. This is probably what you want in most cases. If id.identifier is specified, the identifier is used to determine the randomization in a deterministic fashion from a large pool of pregenerated random bits. Because the numbers are produced in a deterministic fashion, specifying an id basically uses RANDOM &uBS;.ORG as a pseudo-random number generator. The third (date.iso-date) form is similar to the second; it allows the randomization to be based on one of the daily pregenerated files. public web variables handle vUHTTP numeric vStatus string vURI, vHeaders, vContent, vResponse numeric vNum, vLength endvariables ret_strings.DUMMY = "" newinstance "UHTTP", vUHTTP ; Ignore certificate errors as using https vStatus = vUHTTP->SET_FLAGS(3) ; Set the number of strings requested if (strings.DUMMY = 0) strings.DUMMY = 1 endif vNum = strings.DUMMY ; Set the length of the strings if (string_length.DUMMY = 0) string_length.DUMMY = 5 endif vLength = string_length.DUMMY ; Create URI vURI = "https://www.random.org/strings/?num=%%vNum%%%&len=%%vLength%%%&digits=%%digits.DUMMY%%%&upperalpha=%%alphas.DUMMY%%%&loweralpha=on&unique=on&format=plain&rnd=new" ; Call the UHTTP GET operation vStatus = vUHTTP->SEND(vURI, "GET", "", "", vHeaders, vContent, vResponse) if (vStatus < 0) webmessage "Unable to generate random string(s) at this time, error status %%vStatus%%" endif if (vStatus = 200) ret_strings.DUMMY = vContent status_info.DUMMY = "Status 200 - OK" else call LP_HANDLE_ERROR(vStatus,vContent) endif Sequence Generator The Sequence Generator will randomize a given interval of integers, i.e., arrange them in random order. It is pretty easy to write a client to access the sequence generator. The sequence generator accepts only HTTP GET requests, so parameters are passed via encoding in the URL. Parameters Name Possible Values Description min [-1e9,1e9] The lower bound of the interval (inclusive). max [-1e9,1e9] The upper bound of the interval (inclusive). col [1,1e9] The number of columns in which the integers will be arranged. The integers should be read (or processed) left to right across columns. format html | plain Determines the return type of the document that the server produces as its response. If html is specified, the server produces a nicely formatted XHTML document (MIME type text/html), which will display well in a browser but which is somewhat cumbersome to parse. If plain is specified, the server produces as minimalistic document of type plain text (MIME type text/plain) document, which is easy to parse. If you are writing an automated client, you probably want to specify plain here. rnd new | id.identifier | date.iso-date Determines the randomization to use to generate the sequence. If new is specified, then a new randomization will created from the truly random bitstream at RANDOM.ORG. This is probably what you want in most cases. If id.identifier is specified, the identifier is used to determine the randomization in a deterministic fashion from a large pool of pregenerated random bits. Because the numbers are produced in a deterministic fashion, specifying an id basically uses RANDOM. &uBS;ORG as a pseudo-random number generator. The third (date.iso-date) form is similar to the second; it allows the randomization to be based on one of the daily pregenerated files. This form must refer to one of the dates for which files exist, so it must be the current day (according to UTC) or a day in the past. The date must be in ISO 8601 format (i.e., YYYY-MM-DD) or one of the two shorthand strings today or yesterday. The sequence requested must 10,000 numbers or shorter in length, i.e., max-min+1≤1e4. Success If no error occurred, the returned page will contain all the integers in the interval in random order. If XHTML was requested, the numbers will be formatted inside a 
 element. If plain text was requested, the numbers will be separated by line feeds. Multiple columns will be separated by tab characters.

Errors
If an error occurred, a HTTP status code 503 (Service Unavailable) will be returned. The MIME type will be set in accordance with the format parameter that was specified in the request. The body of the the returned page will contain the string "Error:" followed by a string with further details. If XHTML was requested, this message will appear somewhere in the document inside a 
 element. If plain text was requested, it will appear on the first line in the document.

The types of errors can vary. Errors will occur if you specify invalid parameters but can also occur because the server is temporarily overloaded. Reasonable behaviour for a client is to look for the "Error:" string in the page returned by the server and print out the whole line if the string was present. When I get around to it, I will provide a full list of possible errors on this page. In the meantime, feel free to experiment ;-)

You probably want to make sure your client can deal with the full range of HTTP response codes, or at least 200, 301 and 503.

Example
Issuing a HTTP GET request for the following will return the numbers from the interval [1,52] in random order, for example to shuffle a deck of cards. We are requesting plain text and a new randomization, as in the previous example.

https://www.random.org/sequences/?min=1&max=52&col=1&format=plain&rnd=new

; Do the HTTP GET via UHTTP vStatus = vUHTTP->SEND(vURI, "GET", "", "", vHeaders, vContent, vResponse) if (vStatus < 0) status_info.DUMMY = "Unable to generate random string(s) at this time, error status %%vStatus%%" endif
if (vStatus = 200) ret_strings.DUMMY = vContent status_info.DUMMY = "Status 200 - OK" else call LP_HANDLE_ERROR(vStatus,vContent) endif
; ;https://www.random.org/strings/?num=10&len=8&digits=on&upperalpha=on&loweralpha=on&unique=on&format=html&rnd=new ; ;[1,1e4] The number of strings requested. ;len [1,20] The length of the strings. All the strings produced will have the same length. ;digits on | off Determines whether digits (0-9) are allowed to occur in the strings. ;upperalpha on | off Determines whether uppercase alphabetic characters (A-Z) are allowed to occur in the strings. ;loweralpha on | off Determines lowercase alphabetic characters (a-z) are allowed to occur in the strings. ;unique on | off Determines whether the strings picked should be unique (as a series of raffle tickets drawn from a hat) or not (as a series of die rolls). If unique is set to on, then there is the additional constraint that the number of strings requested (num) must be less than or equal to the number of strings that exist with the selected length and characters. ;format html | plain Determines the return type of the document that the server produces as its response. If html is specified, the server produces a nicely formatted XHTML document (MIME type text/html), which will display well in a browser but which is somewhat cumbersome to parse. If plain is specified, the server produces as minimalistic document of type plain text (MIME type text/plain) document, which is easy to parse. If you are writing an automated client, you probably want to specify plain here. ;rnd new | id.identifier | date.iso-date Determines the randomization to use to generate the strings. If new is specified, then a new randomization will created from the truly random bitstream at RANDOM.ORG. This is probably what you want in most cases. If id.identifier is specified, the identifier is used to determine the randomization in a deterministic fashion from a large pool of pregenerated random bits. Because the numbers are produced in a deterministic fashion, specifying an id basically uses RANDOM. &uBS;ORG as a pseudo-random number generator. The third (date.iso-date) form is similar to the second; it allows the randomization to be based on one of the daily pregenerated files. This form must refer to one of the dates for which files exist, so it must be the current day (according to UTC) or a day in the past. The date must be in ISO 8601 format (i.e., YYYY-MM-DD) or one of the two shorthand strings today or yesterday.

; If the SSV Subtype has the 'Data Access' property set to 'DBMS', ; then the Proc statement 'read' is propagated by the UNIFACE Component Engine ; to the DBMS Driver.
; If the SSV subtype has the 'Data Access' property set to 'Entity Service', ; then the first Proc statement 'read' is propagated by the UNIFACE Component Engine ; to the 'uRetr...' operation at the Entity Service. ; At the Entity Service, a sequence of Read Triggers is fired. ; The Proc statement 'read' in these Triggers is propagated by the UNIFACE Component Engine ; to the DBMS Driver. A hitlist is built on the Entity Service. ; After the last 'read' at the Entity Service, the hitlist is implicitly returned to the Session Service. ; Here, another sequence of Read Triggers is fired, in order to load the hitlist into ; the Session Service Component Structure.
read

; If the SSV Subtype has the 'Data Access' property set to 'DBMS', ; then the Proc statement 'write' is propagated by the UNIFACE Component Engine ; to the DBMS Driver.
; If the SSV subtype has the 'Data Access' property set to 'Entity Service', ; then each Proc statement 'write' is propagated by the UNIFACE Component Engine ; to the 'uUpd...' operation at the Entity Service. ; After the last 'write' or 'delete' at the Session Service, the UNIFACE Component Engine ; implicitly activates the 'uEndStore' operation at the Entity Service. ; This operation contains a Proc statement 'store', resulting in ; a sequence of Write and Delete Triggers at the Entity Service. ; There, the Proc statements 'write' and 'delete' are propagated by the UNIFACE Component Engine ; to the DBMS Driver.
write

; If the SSV Subtype has the 'Data Access' property set to 'DBMS', ; then the Proc statement 'delete' is propagated by the UNIFACE Component Engine ; to the DBMS Driver.
; If the SSV subtype has the 'Data Access' property set to 'Entity Service', ; each Proc statement 'delete' is propagated by the UNIFACE Component Engine ; to the 'uUpd...' operation at the Entity Service. ; After the last 'write' or 'delete' at the Session Service, the UNIFACE Component Engine ; implicitly activates the 'uEndStore' operation at the Entity Service. ; This operation contains a Proc statement 'store', resulting in ; a sequence of Write and Delete Triggers at the Entity Service. ; There, the Proc statements 'write' and 'delete' are propagated by the UNIFACE Component Engine ; to the DBMS Driver.
delete

; If the SSV Subtype has the 'Data Access' property set to 'DBMS', ; then the Proc statement 'lock' is propagated by the UNIFACE Component Engine ; to the DBMS Driver.
; If the SSV subtype has the 'Data Access' property set to 'Entity Service', ; then the Proc statement 'lock' is propagated by the UNIFACE Component Engine ; to the 'uLock' operation at the Entity Service. ; At the Entity Service, the Proc statement 'lock' is propagated by the UNIFACE Component Engine ; to the DBMS Driver.
lock if ($status = -10) reload

; For the definition of <myDtd>, see the Defines trigger
operation deleteall params xmlstream [dtd:<myDtd>] x : INOUT numeric pError : OUT string pErrorContext : OUT endparams
pError = 0 ; initialize $procerror return value pErrorContext = "" ; initialize $procerrorcontext return value
xmlload x, "dtd:<myDtd>" ; load xml data x into component structure
if ($status >= 0) ; xmlload successful
#ifdefined ssvEntity if ($empty("<ssvEntity>") = 0) ; there is data #else if ($empty = 0) ; there is data #endif retrieve/reconnect ; fire Read Trigger for changed or deleted occurrences
if ($status = 0) ; validate successful erase
if ($status < 0) ; erase error pError = $procerror pErrorContext = $procerrorcontext rollback
elseif ($status = 0) ; erase successful commit
if ($status < 0) ; commit failed pError = $procerror pErrorContext = $procerrorcontext rollback
endif endif
else ; retrieve/reconnect failed pError = -35 putitem/id pErrorContext, "error", "-35" putitem/id pErrorContext, "component", $componentname putitem/id pErrorContext, "procname", "deleteAll()" putitem/id pErrorContext, "description", "Reconnect failed" rollback endif endif
else ; xmlload failed pError = $procerror pErrorContext = $procerrorcontext endif
; Return the result set as xmlStream to the Client. Validation errors are written ; by the UNIFACE Component Engine in this stream using the 'valerr' meta-attribute. ; Upon loading the xmlStream by the Client, On Error Triggers are fired ; and the errors can be processed. xmlsave x, "dtd:<myDtd>" ; return xml document to client
if ($status < 0) ; xmlsave failed pError = $procerror pErrorContext = $procerrorcontext endif
; Possible errors are reported in 'error' and 'errorcontext' return (0) End ; operation deleteAll

; For the definition of <myDtd>, see the Defines trigger
operation load params xmlstream [dtd:<myDtd>] x : INOUT numeric pError : OUT string pErrorContext : OUT endparams
pError = 0 ; initialize $procerror return value pErrorContext = "" ; initialize $procerrorcontext return value
xmlload x, "dtd:<myDtd>" ; load retrieve-profile x into component structure
if ($status >= 0) ; xmlload successful retrieve
if ($status = 0) ; retrieve successful xmlsave x, "dtd:<myDtd>" endif endif
pError = $procerror pErrorContext = $procerrorcontext
; Possible errors are reported in 'error' and 'errorContext' return (0)
End ; operation load

; For the definition of <myDtd>, see the Defines trigger
operation save params xmlstream [dtd:<myDtd>] x : INOUT numeric pError : OUT string pErrorContext : OUT endparams
pError = 0 ; initialize $procerror return value pErrorContext = "" ; initialize $procerrorcontext return value
xmlload x, "dtd:<myDtd>" ; load xml data x into component structure
if ($status >= 0) ; xmlload successful
#ifdefined ssvEntity if ($empty("<ssvEntity>") = 0) ; there is data #else if ($empty = 0) ; there is data #endif retrieve/reconnect ; fire Read Trigger for changed or deleted occurrences
if ($status = 0) ; reconnect successful store ; validate and store
if ($status < 0) ; store error pError = $procerror pErrorContext = $procerrorcontext rollback
elseif ($status = 0) ; store successful commit
if ($status < 0) ; commit failed pError = $procerror pErrorContext = $procerrorcontext rollback
endif endif
else ; retrieve/reconnect failed pError = -35 putitem/id pErrorContext, "error", "-35" putitem/id pErrorContext, "component", $componentname putitem/id pErrorContext, "procname", "Save()" putitem/id pErrorContext, "description", "Reconnect failed" rollback endif endif
else ; xmlload failed pError = $procerror pErrorContext = $procerrorcontext endif
; Return the result set as xmlStream to the Client. Validation errors are written ; by the UNIFACE Component Engine in this stream using the 'valerr' meta-attributes. ; Upon loading the xmlStream by the Client, On Error Triggers are fired ; and the errors can be processed. xmlsave x, "dtd:<myDtd>" ; return xml document to client
if ($status < 0) ; xmlsave failed pError = $procerror pErrorContext = $procerrorcontext endif
; Possible errors are reported in 'error' and 'errorContext' return (0) End ; operation save

partner operation zProcError ; Report an unexpected failure in a Proc statement. ; pre : context contains information about $procErrorContext ; post: context is displayed to the user params string pContext : IN endparams variables string vError, vComponentName, vOperationName, vErrorDescr endvariables getitem/id vError, pContext, "error" getitem/id vComponentName, pContext, "component" getitem/id vOperationName, pContext, "procname" getitem/id vErrorDescr, pContext, "description" #ifdefined uspEntity $webinfo("OUTPUT") = "%%$webinfo("OUTPUT")
%%%Error detected by %%vComponentName%%%, operation %%vOperationName%%%. %%vErrorDescr%%% (%%vError%%%)" ; Show error in USP. #else message/error "Error detected by %%vComponentName%%%, operation %%vOperationName%%%. %%vErrorDescr%%% (%%vError%%%)" #endif End ; operation zProcError
